news_summary: Innovative technologies are advancing sustainability and efficiency, with NASA-inspired textiles showcased in France, AI cutting costs in Netflix productions, and robots exhibiting collective intelligence principles.
news_summary_fr: Les technologies innovantes font progresser la durabilité et l'efficacité, avec des textiles inspirés de la NASA présentés en France, l'IA réduisant les coûts dans les productions Netflix, et des robots présentant des principes d'intelligence collective.
news_summary_es: Las tecnologías innovadoras hacen avanzar la sostenibilidad y la eficiencia: en Francia se exhiben tejidos inspirados en la NASA, la IA reduce costes en las producciones de Netflix y los robots exhiben principios de inteligencia colectiva.

articles.title: NASA-Derived Textiles are Touring France by Bike
articles.summary: During the Tour de France, athletes have to maintain a constant speed while bike riding for dozens of miles through cold rains and summer heat. These cyclists need gear that adapts to the different environments they encounter. One company is using a material with NASA origins to ensure these athletes stay comfortable while taking their […]
articles.content:
This woman is wearing an Ekoï jersey made from Outlast. The phase-change materials incorporated into the fabric help the wearer stay comfortable in any temperature. Credit: Ekoï

During the Tour de France, athletes have to maintain a constant speed while bike riding for dozens of miles through cold rains and summer heat. These cyclists need gear that adapts to the different environments they encounter. One company is using a material with NASA origins to ensure these athletes stay comfortable while taking their grand tours.

Phase-change materials use basic properties of matter to maintain a steady temperature. When a substance melts from a solid to a liquid, the material absorbs heat, and when it becomes solid again, it releases that heat. In the 1980s, Triangle Research Corporation received a NASA Small Business Innovation Research award to explore how phase-change materials could be incorporated into textiles to control temperatures in spacesuit gloves. By placing phase-change materials in small capsules woven throughout a textile, these temperature-regulating properties can be tuned to the comfort of the human body. While these textiles weren’t incorporated into any gloves flown on NASA missions, they formed the basis for a new product, sold under the name Outlast.

Spacesuit gloves have to be both dexterous enough to use tools and insulating enough to protect against the temperature extremes of working in space. Working with industry, NASA explored the use of phase-change materials for these purposes, which was later commercialized under the name Outlast. Credit: NASA

Outlast has since become one of the most widely distributed temperature-regulating fabrics, found in products such as bedding, loungewear, and office chairs. It has seen especially extensive use in activewear, ranging from jogging clothes to professional sports gear.

Founded in 2001 and based in Fréjus, France, the company Ekoï makes clothing and accessories for cyclists, particularly those who bike competitively. The company first encountered Outlast at the Performance Days fabric trade fair in Munich, Germany, and was impressed with its capabilities as well as its NASA heritage.

“When you say NASA, it’s always impressive.” said Celine Milan, director of textiles at Ekoï. “At the beginning we were even saying in here in our offices, ‘Wow, this technology was developed by NASA.’ It’s on another level.”

Ekoi’s Outlast line officially launched in July 2022, during that year’s Tour de France. Over the course of that race, the company found it improved cyclists’ performance in the event’s mountain stages, where elevation changes mean wide swings in temperature. It also improved athletes’ aerodynamics, as their jerseys could stay closed in warmer environments, rather than opening them to let in wind.

Today, Ekoï sells several products that incorporate Outlast materials, including jerseys, gloves, and socks. These products are internationally known for their NASA heritage. Whether engineering for astronaut’s comfort in space or competitive athletes, NASA aims for excellence.

Learn more about NASA’s Spinoff Technologies: https://spinoff.nasa.gov/
articles.reasoning: The article highlights a positive technological innovation derived from NASA research that benefits athletes by improving comfort and performance in challenging conditions. It showcases successful commercialization of space technology for everyday use, inspiring and hopeful for future applications.
articles.personality_title: NASA-inspired clothing keeps Tour de France cyclists comfortable
articles.personality_presentation:
**Context**
Cyclists in the Tour de France face tough conditions, riding long distances through cold rain and hot summer weather. They need clothing that can adjust to these changing temperatures to stay comfortable.

**What happened**
A company called Ekoï is using a special fabric named Outlast, originally developed by NASA. This fabric contains phase-change materials that absorb, store, and release heat, helping cyclists stay comfortable whether it’s cold or hot.

**Impact**
Thanks to this innovative clothing, athletes can maintain their performance without being distracted by uncomfortable temperatures. It’s a great example of space technology being used to improve everyday products.

**What's next step**
This success could encourage more sportswear brands to adopt similar materials, making outdoor activities more comfortable for everyone.

**One-sentence takeaway**
NASA’s space-age fabric is helping Tour de France cyclists stay cool and comfortable, showing how space tech can improve life on Earth.
articles.personality_title_fr: Des vêtements inspirés par la NASA pour le confort des cyclistes du Tour de France
articles.personality_presentation_fr:
**Contexte**
Les cyclistes du Tour de France affrontent des conditions difficiles, parcourant de longues distances sous la pluie froide et la chaleur estivale. Ils ont besoin de vêtements qui s’adaptent à ces températures changeantes pour rester confortables.

**Ce qui s’est passé**
Une entreprise appelée Ekoï utilise un tissu spécial nommé Outlast, développé à l’origine par la NASA. Ce tissu contient des matériaux à changement de phase qui absorbent, stockent et libèrent la chaleur, aidant les cyclistes à rester à l’aise qu’il fasse froid ou chaud.

**Impact**
Grâce à ces vêtements innovants, les athlètes peuvent maintenir leurs performances sans être gênés par l’inconfort thermique. C’est un bel exemple de technologie spatiale utilisée pour améliorer des produits du quotidien.

**Prochaine étape**
Ce succès pourrait encourager davantage de marques de vêtements de sport à adopter des matériaux similaires, rendant les activités de plein air plus confortables pour tous.

**Message clé**
Le tissu high-tech de la NASA aide les cyclistes du Tour de France à rester frais et confortables, montrant comment la technologie spatiale peut améliorer la vie sur Terre.
articles.personality_title_es: Ropa inspirada en la NASA mantiene cómodos a los ciclistas del Tour de Francia
articles.personality_presentation_es:
**Contexto**
Los ciclistas del Tour de Francia enfrentan condiciones difíciles, recorriendo largas distancias bajo lluvia fría y calor de verano. Necesitan ropa que se adapte a estos cambios de temperatura para mantenerse cómodos.

**Qué pasó**
Una empresa llamada Ekoï está usando una tela especial llamada Outlast, desarrollada originalmente por la NASA. Esta tela contiene materiales de cambio de fase que absorben, almacenan y liberan calor, ayudando a los ciclistas a mantenerse cómodos tanto en frío como en calor.

**Impacto**
Gracias a esta ropa innovadora, los atletas pueden mantener su rendimiento sin molestias por el calor o el frío. Es un gran ejemplo de tecnología espacial usada para mejorar productos cotidianos.

**Próximo paso**
Este éxito podría motivar a más marcas deportivas a usar materiales similares, haciendo que las actividades al aire libre sean más cómodas para todos.

**Mensaje principal**
La tela espacial de la NASA ayuda a los ciclistas del Tour de Francia a mantenerse frescos y cómodos, demostrando cómo la tecnología espacial puede mejorar la vida en la Tierra.
articles.image_prompt: A detailed, warm painting of a sleek bicycle jersey and gloves made of glowing fabric interwoven with tiny, stylized capsules symbolizing phase-change materials, draped over a racing bicycle leaning against a gentle mountain landscape that transitions from cool blue shadows to warm golden sunlight, with subtle abstract hints of space elements like a softly glowing planet and stars in the sky to represent NASA’s influence.

articles.title: Netflix uses AI effects for first time to cut costs
articles.summary: The streaming firm says AI allowed The Eternaut to complete a sequence faster and cheaper.
articles.content:
Netflix uses AI effects for first time to cut costs

The use of generative AI is controversial in the entertainment industry over concerns it creates content using others' work without their consent and fears that it will replace the work of humans.

He said the technology allowed the production team to complete sequences faster and at a lower cost.

The streaming giant's co-chief executive Ted Sarandos said AI, which produces videos and images based on prompts, was used to create a scene of a building collapsing in the Argentine science fiction show, The Eternaut.

Netflix says it has used visual effects created by generative artificial intelligence (AI) in one of its original TV shows for the first time.

Mr Sarandos made his comments as Netflix announced a 16% rise in revenue to $11bn (£8.25bn) for the three months to the end of June compared to the same period last year. Profits rose from $2.1bn to $3.1bn.

The streaming firm said the better-than-expected performance was boosted by the success of the third and final series of South Korean thriller Squid Game, which has so far attracted 122 million views.

Asked about Netflix's use of AI, Mr Sarandos said the technology has allowed productions with smaller budgets to use advanced visual effects.

The generative AI used in The Eternaut helped its production team to complete a sequence showing the collapse of a building in Buenos Aires 10 times faster than if they had used traditional special effects tools, he said.

"The cost of it would just wouldn't have been feasible for a show in that budget.

"That sequence actually is the very first [generative] AI final footage to appear on screen in a Netflix original series or film. So the creators were thrilled with the result," said Mr Sarandos.

AI was among the key concerns raised during a Hollywood strike in 2023.

During the three-month walkout, the Screen Actors Guild–American Federation of Television and Radio Artists union called for tighter regulation of the use of AI.

Some in the industry have criticised the use of AI in film, calling it degrading to the craft.

In 2024, film mogul Tyler Perry halted plans for a $800m expansion of his studio in Atlanta over fears that the rapid advancement in AI-generated videos would affect jobs.

AI tools like OpenAI's Sora were being announced at the time, causing awe at the quality of footage it could create from simple text prompts, but also concerns about job security.

Davier Yoon, co-founder of Singapore animation studio CraveFX, said Netflix's adoption of generative AI came as no surprise as more major studios are welcoming the technology.

Generative AI adds to the list of digital tools that visual effect artists can pick to bring ideas to life, he said.

"It feels like a matter of time. AI definitely opens the gate to allow smaller studios to achieve big budget-looking visuals," said Mr Yoon.

"Ultimately, it is the artist who decides what is in the final image, not AI."
articles.reasoning: The article highlights Netflix's innovative use of generative AI to reduce production costs and speed up visual effects creation, enabling smaller-budget productions to achieve high-quality visuals. While there are concerns about AI's impact on jobs and creativity, the story focuses on technological progress and creative empowerment, which is generally positive and hopeful.
articles.personality_title: Netflix uses AI to speed up and save on movie effects
articles.personality_presentation:
**Context**
Netflix, a giant in streaming entertainment, is trying out new technology to make its shows and movies faster and cheaper. Using AI (artificial intelligence) to create visual effects is a fresh step in an industry worried about AI replacing human jobs or copying others’ work.

**What happened**
Netflix used AI for the first time in its show The Eternaut to create a complex scene. This technology helps make videos and images by following instructions quickly. It let the production team finish parts of the show faster and save money on expensive effects.

**Impact**
By using AI, Netflix can bring big, high-quality visuals even to smaller projects that don’t have huge budgets. This means more creative stories can be told without the usual heavy costs, helping filmmakers and audiences alike.

**What's next step**
Netflix plans to explore more ways to use AI carefully, balancing creativity and fairness. They want to make sure AI helps people make better art without taking away jobs or copying work unfairly.

**One-sentence takeaway**
Netflix’s smart use of AI is opening doors for faster, more affordable, and creative entertainment while navigating new challenges thoughtfully.
articles.personality_title_fr: Netflix utilise l’IA pour accélérer et réduire le coût des effets spéciaux
articles.personality_presentation_fr:
**Contexte**
Netflix, un géant du streaming, teste une nouvelle technologie pour rendre ses films et séries plus rapides et moins chers. Utiliser l’IA (intelligence artificielle) pour créer des effets visuels est une étape nouvelle dans un secteur inquiet que l’IA remplace les emplois humains ou copie le travail des autres.

**Ce qui s’est passé**
Netflix a utilisé l’IA pour la première fois dans la série The Eternaut afin de créer une scène complexe. Cette technologie fabrique des vidéos et images en suivant des instructions rapidement. Elle a permis à l’équipe de production de finir des parties de la série plus vite et à moindre coût.

**Impact**
Grâce à l’IA, Netflix peut offrir de grands effets visuels de qualité même pour des projets avec des budgets plus petits. Cela signifie que davantage d’histoires créatives peuvent être racontées sans les coûts lourds habituels, aidant ainsi réalisateurs et spectateurs.

**Prochaine étape**
Netflix compte explorer davantage l’usage de l’IA avec prudence, en équilibrant créativité et justice. Ils veulent s’assurer que l’IA aide à créer de meilleurs contenus sans enlever des emplois ni copier injustement.

**Une phrase à retenir**
L’utilisation intelligente de l’IA par Netflix ouvre la voie à un divertissement plus rapide, abordable et créatif tout en gérant avec soin les nouveaux défis.
articles.personality_title_es: Netflix usa IA para acelerar y ahorrar en efectos visuales
articles.personality_presentation_es:
**Contexto**
Netflix, un gigante del streaming, está probando nueva tecnología para hacer sus películas y series más rápido y barato. Usar IA (inteligencia artificial) para crear efectos visuales es un paso nuevo en una industria preocupada porque la IA reemplace trabajos humanos o copie el trabajo de otros.

**Qué pasó**
Netflix usó IA por primera vez en la serie The Eternaut para crear una escena compleja. Esta tecnología ayuda a hacer videos e imágenes siguiendo instrucciones rápidamente. Permitió al equipo de producción terminar partes del show más rápido y ahorrar dinero en efectos caros.

**Impacto**
Con la IA, Netflix puede ofrecer efectos visuales grandes y de alta calidad incluso a proyectos con presupuestos más bajos. Esto significa que se pueden contar más historias creativas sin los costos habituales elevados, beneficiando a cineastas y espectadores.

**Próximo paso**
Netflix planea explorar más formas de usar IA con cuidado, equilibrando la creatividad y la justicia. Quieren asegurarse de que la IA ayude a crear mejor arte sin quitar empleos ni copiar trabajo de manera injusta.

**Frase clave**
El uso inteligente de la IA por parte de Netflix abre puertas para un entretenimiento más rápido, accesible y creativo, enfrentando con cuidado los nuevos retos.
articles.image_prompt: A detailed, warm-toned painting of a futuristic city skyline with a stylized digital brush gently transforming one building into a glowing, pixelated structure collapsing gracefully, surrounded by calm figures made of light holding paintbrushes and film reels, symbolizing the creative harmony between artists and AI technology.

articles.title: Robots demonstrate principles of collective intelligence
articles.summary: Nature, Published online: 17 July 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-02269-4Lessons from developmental biology can be used to guide the behaviour of robot swarms.
articles.content: Thank you for visiting nature.com. You are using a browser version with limited support for CSS. To obtain the best experience, we recommend you use a more up to date browser (or turn off compatibility mode in Internet Explorer). In the meantime, to ensure continued support, we are displaying the site without styles and JavaScript.
articles.reasoning: The article discusses how principles from developmental biology are being applied to guide the behavior of robot swarms, representing a scientific breakthrough in robotics and collective intelligence. This advancement in technology has potential positive implications for solving complex problems through cooperation among robots.
articles.personality_title: Robots learn teamwork from biology to solve problems better
articles.personality_presentation:
**Context**
Scientists have been exploring how groups of robots, called swarms, can work together more effectively. They took inspiration from developmental biology, the study of how living things grow and organize themselves.

**What happened**
Researchers used lessons from biology to program robot swarms so they behave like cells in a growing organism. This means the robots can coordinate their actions naturally, without a leader telling them what to do.

**Impact**
This new approach helps robots solve complex tasks by working as a team, just like cells in a body. It’s a breakthrough that could improve robotics in areas like search and rescue, environmental monitoring, and more.

**What's next step**
Scientists plan to test these biologically inspired robots in real-world situations, refining their teamwork skills to handle even bigger challenges.

**One-sentence takeaway**
By learning from nature’s teamwork, robots can now cooperate smarter to tackle tough problems together.
articles.personality_title_fr: Les robots apprennent le travail d'équipe grâce à la biologie pour mieux résoudre les problèmes
articles.personality_presentation_fr:
**Contexte**
Des scientifiques explorent comment des groupes de robots, appelés essaims, peuvent mieux collaborer. Ils se sont inspirés de la biologie du développement, l’étude de la croissance et de l’organisation des êtres vivants.

**Ce qui s’est passé**
Les chercheurs ont utilisé des leçons de biologie pour programmer des essaims de robots afin qu’ils se comportent comme des cellules dans un organisme en croissance. Cela permet aux robots de coordonner naturellement leurs actions, sans chef.

**Impact**
Cette nouvelle méthode aide les robots à résoudre des tâches complexes en équipe, comme les cellules dans un corps. C’est une avancée qui pourrait améliorer la robotique pour la recherche, la surveillance de l’environnement, et plus encore.

**Prochaine étape**
Les scientifiques vont tester ces robots inspirés de la biologie dans des situations réelles, pour améliorer encore leur travail d’équipe face à de plus grands défis.

**Message clé**
En s’inspirant du travail d’équipe de la nature, les robots coopèrent plus intelligemment pour relever ensemble des défis difficiles.
articles.personality_title_es: Los robots aprenden a trabajar en equipo gracias a la biología para resolver problemas mejor
articles.personality_presentation_es:
**Contexto**
Los científicos han estado explorando cómo grupos de robots, llamados enjambres, pueden trabajar juntos de manera más efectiva. Se inspiraron en la biología del desarrollo, que estudia cómo los seres vivos crecen y se organizan.

**Qué pasó**
Los investigadores usaron lecciones de biología para programar enjambres de robots para que se comporten como células en un organismo en crecimiento. Esto hace que los robots coordinen sus acciones de forma natural, sin un líder que los dirija.

**Impacto**
Este nuevo enfoque ayuda a los robots a resolver tareas complejas trabajando en equipo, igual que las células en un cuerpo. Es un avance que podría mejorar la robótica en áreas como búsqueda y rescate, monitoreo ambiental y más.

**Próximo paso**
Los científicos planean probar estos robots inspirados en la biología en situaciones reales, mejorando sus habilidades de trabajo en equipo para enfrentar desafíos mayores.

**Mensaje clave**
Al aprender del trabajo en equipo de la naturaleza, los robots pueden cooperar de manera más inteligente para resolver juntos problemas difíciles.
articles.image_prompt: A detailed, warm painting of a group of small, friendly robots working together harmoniously, interconnected by glowing lines symbolizing collective intelligence, set against a soft, natural background with gentle earth tones and subtle light.
